TopicTitle: What will you do when .21 hits?

Articles.Content:
Load up the new VAB, extinguish the smouldering wreckage of my processor, cry muchly. On the off chance that it /does/ work, I'll send my new mothership on a round mission to Laythe with a station and a load of stuff for a new Laythe colony. The game'll probably crash once I pass the start menu. Yay. Stupid bottom-end PC.

The new buildings apparently have fewer polygons than the older one and should therefore be less processor-intensive.

First of all, I am going to de-orbit my space station before I update.

Then I pick a SRB with a pod, fire it onto the air, quit, and resume it!
Recreate my traditional 1 man Mun and Minmus landings.

I'm gonna restart my modular interplanetary ship program. I discontinued it after, in a moment of rage, I rammed 4 hours of in-space construction with the newest module because the RCS wouldn't stop oscillating. Hopefully the new ASAS will fix that.
Think I'm gonna try my hand at making one of these. But orky. Gots ta keep it orky.
I'm going straight to the Mun to check out the new Terrain

What I'll do? Hmmm...

How about screwing around with everything because my computer is so dang horrible? (Seriously, my computer is from 2 years ago, and it runs KSP with the yellow timer constantly. I need a more powerful computer... )

I'm hoping there will be new things to fly to. Just a couple, maybe. If not, well, I have not followed the development and I'm kind of staying away from learning details, because I like to be surprised.

I've barely played 20.2. So, I expect I'll find plenty to do.

Can't wait to start fresh! I'm going to follow the space program I found on the Wiki. I started playing in 0.20 and went straight for the moon. If I crashed or ran out of delta-V, I just held down F9 until I did it.

I felt dirty after. Damn my excitement and impatience.

This time, I'm going to follow a realistic space program and if I fail, I fail. I won't deny I'm totally relieved that the craft files are being saved, though. I've spent some serious hours fine-tuning some of them.

I'm looking at 0.20 as my practice run where I learn the mechanics of KSP. 0.21 will be my 'do or die' true run.

Well, until the saves break again
First, try bunch of ridiculous designs and blow stuff up on purpose, second go to the mun to see the new craters, and after that continue to crash things
Exploring the new freakingly beautiful Mun landscape

1) Start fresh with a new save

2) Hire Kerbonauts

3) Explore the new KSC

4) Fly around Kerbin, admiring the terrain

5) Muck around with spaceplane parts

6) Go to the mun, and land next to a procedural crater

7) Start a refueling outpost in LKO

8) Build some spaceplanes for my company with the new parts

9) Construct a space station, while using the refueling outpost to refuel and transfer to high kerbin orbit

10) Plan a mission to Duna

11) Recreate SuestraGamingHD's Aurora Station

12) Build a mun base once the kethane pack has updated

then... business as usual
I will test out all the new features! And then continue my quest for kethane series!
I'll go ahead and try to mess with the crater generating system. By poking it with truss pieces. Sorry HarvesteR.
Sit in the VAB for a few hours whilst crying about losing the ol' VAB, but also drooling at the new one.

I'm going to stick with .20 for a little bit. Last time there was an update, a new version was released shortly thereafter. This way a really bad bug doesn't sneak in.

Also, I am finishing up a detailed ISS assembly with stock parts. It's taken me over 13 launches to assemble so far (which is frustrating, since the 51.6 degree inclination and 400 km orbit makes it harder to get to than a normal space station). I hope there's a way I can save it, but at least I'll have the rockets to launch it.
I think I might do the wiki campaign http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Campaigns with stock for a bit. Or at least until all my favourite mods are compatible.
I'm currently working on new base designs which I'll be sending to the Mun, etc once 0.21 hits.

I think I'm going to wait for KSPX to update, so I've got all the parts I need, then I'm going to keep to a semi-real space program that loosely follows our real world advances. I've made an awesome Luna 16 replica with the KSPX cylindrical fuel tanks, just waiting for 0.21 to fly it
I'll be seeing how fast the kerbals reproduce... All in the name of science!
Wait for the inevitable flurry of bugfix releases to subside and for my favourite mods to update, then get started on planning a manned expedition to Duna.

I plan on doing something a little more organized than I have done in the past (e.g. basic orbital operations before going straight for the mun), but probably not to the extent of the wiki campaign.

Probably something like Orbiters -> satellite network -> space station -> Mun orbiter -> Mun lander -> Minmus orbiter -> Minmus lander. Beyond that, it'll depend on my construction skills
As well as checking out the new space center, I'll be able to write the second part of this little story.
Fly to Mun and hang out with all the craters. Obviously.

Instead of mocking up the entire space program, which I tend to do with wipe updates, I think I will also "Shoot for the Mun".

After that probably work on a Mun base, space stations, Duna and other planet/moon missions, the works.
